xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 09 July 2013
xwikidoc.content: <phenotips_org> has joined #medsavant 10:50 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea, what's up? 10:50 <bvancea> hey 10:50 <bvancea> pretty good 10:51 <bvancea> I've been struggling with something for the last 2 hours 10:51 <bvancea> just got it to work 10:53 <bvancea> now I'm going to start working on the result set classes 10:53 <bvancea> some queries can either return some terms, or the whole entity 10:54 <bvancea> and how are you? 10:55 <sdumitriu> Good 10:56 <sdumitriu> Preparing to go to the office 10:57 <bvancea> oh, I see 10:59 <bvancea> I tend to forget about the timezone difference :) 12:01 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 14:28 <bvancea> I pushed some of my work from the last week, forgot to do it before 16:06 <marta> bvancea: call me lazy, but i would totally write a script to generate most of this stuff: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/medsavant/commit/792484484d029e1d64cb5d2578cde0a68c986aaa#L5R20 16:07 <marta> "generate the generator" :) 16:07 <bvancea> hello marta 16:08 <marta> (hi) 16:08 <bvancea> you mean, the keywords and lowercasing 16:08 <bvancea> ? 16:08 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:08 <marta> yes 16:09 <bvancea> well, I was always a supporter of this kind of lazy-ness 16:09 <bvancea> and how would that work? 16:09 <sdumitriu1> I guess that's an artifact of the fact that grammars are case sensitive 16:09 <sdumitriu1> And query languages are case insensitive 16:09 <marta> well with maven you can always run the generating script before you actually need to use the grammar 16:11 <sdumitriu1> bvancea: One way is to use this: http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-remote-resources-plugin/process-mojo.html 16:11 <marta> yes, sdumitriu1 can help with that, he's the maven maven 16:11 <marta> ok, enough puns for today :) 16:11 <bvancea> haha 16:11 <bvancea> :))) 16:12 <sdumitriu1> But the remote resources plugin works with "remote" resources 16:12 <sdumitriu1> So that would add another step... 16:12 <sdumitriu1> So that would add another module... 16:13 <bvancea> remote as in a different module in a maven repository 16:13 <bvancea> could just as well be my own local repo, right? 16:13 <bvancea> hehe 16:13 <sdumitriu1> But there's the http://code.google.com/p/velocity-maven-plugin/wiki/HowToUseThePlugin 16:13 <bvancea> I haven't created the new modules yet, since Miro hasn't commented anything on it 16:13 <bvancea> I do hope he'll agree 16:13 <bvancea> :D 16:13 <sdumitriu1> Which works with resources from another directory 16:14 <bvancea> nice 16:14 <sdumitriu1> But I'm not as lazy as Marta, so I think this can wait 16:15 <sdumitriu1> It's OK to have that verbose boilerplate code in the grammar file 16:15 <bvancea> so the main idea would be to have grammar file as a resource, then use the plug-in to insert the keywords + lowercase ? 16:15 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:15 <bvancea> nice 16:15 <bvancea> I'll try it 16:15 <sdumitriu1> src/main/sablecc-template/jpql.grammar.vm 16:16 <bvancea> but after I get more work done on the actual module functionality 16:16 <sdumitriu1> velocity-maven-plugin transforms that into src/main/sablecc/jpql.grammar 16:16 <bvancea> hmmm 16:16 <sdumitriu1> sablecc-maven-plugin transforms that into a parser 16:16 <bvancea> so the .vm file will contain some velocity variables 16:17 <bvancea> which will get replaced by the plug-in? 16:17 <bvancea> I think populated is a better word 16:18 <sdumitriu1> And instead of a, b, c... you just have: 16:18 <sdumitriu1> #foreach ($letter in ['a', 'b', 'c', ... 'z']) 16:18 <sdumitriu1> #end 16:18 <sdumitriu1> There are ways to get a..z nicely without explicitly listing every letter 16:19 <bvancea> oh 16:19 <bvancea> nice :D
